file_content.text: The Lords of Chance clearly favor the Empire. I'll have to start practicing the Imperial salute....
It's done. The Republic won't be recovering from the damage we've inflicted.
Truly, the Lords of Chance love a winner. Your path must be paved in solid aurodium.
My employer wishes to congratulate you personally--and offer a gift. I present Godoba the Hutt of the Shadow Syndicate....
How pleasing to see you again. I'm glad we had this opportunity to work together and smooth over past differences.
Don't think anyone's forgotten what a fickle worm you are, Godoba.
You're not forgiven.
Please, let us move beyond this. Can't you see that I wish to be your friend?
It is always a pleasure to greet powerful allies. I have long admired the Empire's taste in heroes.
Words are the least sincere form of appreciation. What else have you got?
Flattery is cheap.
You are shrewd. I admire that--and will reward it.
It's been a long battle. My patience has worn thin.
Get to the point.
We couldn't have beaten the Republic without your help, Godoba.
We appreciate your assistance.
I am glad you acknowledge this.
A great opportunity has revealed itself to strengthen the bonds of our grand alliance. My servant will explain.
The Republic is evacuating the wretched little families of its diplomats and researchers. We'll destroy their transport on your order. But we must be quick.
Killing the enemy's resolve is the fastest way to win a war. Take away their reason to fight, and they'll collapse.
The enemy will be demoralized.
You understand the strategy.
You people are utterly immoral. I like that.
I enjoy committing atrocities.
We thought you'd appreciate the gesture.
When I hear "gift," I expect something I can spend.
That's not my idea of a gift.
Notoriety is a currency you can spend to generate new opportunities. Just think how you'll impress the Empire.
Why is the Shadow Syndicate willing to do this?
That's quite an offer.
Imperials are our best customers. We just want you to be happy.
We're under strict orders to keep this conflict quiet. Killing a ship full of civilians would attract attention.
Zavrasha wouldn't approve.
What's more important, pleasing some petty bureaucrat or stabbing your foe in the heart?
Why isn't there time to think this through--or consult my superiors?
What's the rush?
The transport is about to depart. If it jumps to hyperspace, we'll lose our chance.
If their families pay the price of failure, the Republic will think twice before sending more people to Nar Shaddaa.
This is the perfect opportunity to bury your enemy's ambitions forever. Say the word, and we'll ensure that transport never reaches its destination.
Make their deaths painful--and memorable.
Yes, kill them all.
Thank you for accepting my gift. You won't be disappointed!
Receiving a transmission... our unmarked warship just intercepted the Republic transport. I'm sorry you can't see the fireball. It's spectacular.
Just knowing the Republic's loved ones are dead is enough.
Well done.
Your unmarked warship had better remain a mystery.
Keep the Empire's name clean.
The Republic won't be able to prove a thing. We'll tell them it was Sisar pirates. They'll get the message.
I'm sure your warship's holo-imagers saved a detailed record.
Make me a recording.
Excellent idea. I'll see what we can do.
The Shadow Syndicate will need to find a more appropriate gift for the Empire than committing war crimes.
No, we don't kill civilians.
You are so difficult to please! But I will keep trying. Enjoy your victory over the Republic. Farewell.
Colonel Harok is waiting for you at the spaceport. It's been a pleasure. May the Lords of Chance always smile on you.
Your contacts are waiting. May the Lords of Chance smile upon you.
Welcome, my new Imperial friends! The Lords of Chance are sorting the quick from the dead in here. Which will you be?
Welcome, friend! The Lords of Chance are busy sorting the quick from the dead. I hope you fall into the former category.
Speed is not a factor in my survival--only the power of the Force.
The dark side conquers all.
The Lords of Chance are known to respect brute strength, from time to time. I'm sure you'll abide.
I'm quick as lightning. Is that good enough?
I'm faster than anything.
I would think so. Remind me never to race you.
I don't know who these "Lords of Chance" think they are, but deciding who lives and dies is my business.
I do the sorting around here.
And from the look of you, business must be good.
It's easy to dodge trouble when you see it coming. My vision has always been excellent.
I'm fast when it matters.
Eyes in the back of your head, eh? I'd expect nothing less from an Imperial spy.
I thought you belonged to the Shadow Syndicate. Are these "Lords of Chance" friends of yours?
"Lords of Chance"?
Friends, indeed. They've kept me healthy and wealthy for years. They watch over gamblers. Protect and profit the risk-takers. But enough about them.
Just when I thought I'd met all the crazy people on Nar Shaddaa.... Tell me why we're talking--and make it quick.
What sort of lunatic are you?
No need to be so gruff. I'm here to help.
The Shadow Syndicate is at your command. Along with Imperial Intelligence, we're here to support your campaign against the Republic.
The Empire has many enemies. We'll ensure they fail. Speak to the contacts on the list I'm transmitting you. They'll have details.
Things are about to get violent. If you value your life, find a place to hide.
Stay out of the way.
The Lords of Chance always protect the clever beings who take cover. But thank you for the warning.
What level of threat response should we expect?
How much opposition is there?
What are the mission objectives, besides killing Republic forces?
Just tell me the plan.
The goal is to sabotage the enemy's efforts by whatever means necessary. Your contacts know more than me.
This area is deadly, but take heart--your odds of surviving are nearly even.
Return to me when you've crushed your enemies. We'll have business to discuss. Good luck.
Apologies. I am awaiting people of great importance. I regret you do not qualify.
